# Test cases for test_clamp: clamp(value, min, max)
# Format: value min max expected
# Returns: min if value < min, max if value > max, else value

# 1. Value within range (10 cases)
5 0 10 5
0 0 10 0
10 0 10 10
3 0 10 3
7 0 10 7
-5 -10 10 -5
-3 -10 10 -3
50 0 100 50
25 0 100 25
75 0 100 75

# 2. Value below min (clamped to min) (10 cases)
-5 0 10 0
-100 0 10 0
-1 0 10 0
-50 -10 10 -10
-20 -10 10 -10
-100 -50 50 -50
-60 -50 50 -50
-1000 0 100 0
-5 1 10 1
-10 -5 5 -5

# 3. Value above max (clamped to max) (10 cases)
15 0 10 10
100 0 10 10
11 0 10 10
20 -10 10 10
50 -10 10 10
100 -50 50 50
60 -50 50 50
1000 0 100 100
15 1 10 10
10 -5 5 5

# 4. Value equals min (5 cases)
0 0 10 0
-10 -10 10 -10
1 1 10 1
-50 -50 50 -50
-100 -100 100 -100

# 5. Value equals max (5 cases)
10 0 10 10
10 -10 10 10
10 1 10 10
50 -50 50 50
100 -100 100 100

# 6. Negative ranges (5 cases)
-5 -10 -1 -5
-15 -10 -1 -10
0 -10 -1 -1
-3 -10 -1 -3
-7 -10 -1 -7

# 7. Edge cases (5 cases)
0 0 0 0
5 5 5 5
-5 -5 -5 -5
100 50 150 100
-100 -150 -50 -100
